features: ★Classic Games--- Retro handheld game console built in 168 classic nostalgia games, let you back to your childhood and enjoy family entertainment time.
★Support Playing on TV-- Easy to connect the game console with TV( AV connector cable is included), enjoy the larger screen gaming experience.
★Longtime Playing --- The battery is rechargeable and in large capacity: 700mAh, Each full charging enable you play up to 5~6 hours.
★Easy to Carry --- Ultra slim handheld game console, convenient while on the go or on a trip,perfect electronic games console for kids/adults.
★Great Gift for Your Child --- Maybe you will be pleasantly surprised to find the talent of the nowadays children for playing games is so powerful.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The classic FC games The classic FC games Easy to play. Fun for kids and adults, it comes with most of the old games you used to play, It is a perfect companion to keep your children occupied and have a good time playing. Enjoy your parent-child time and it would be fun for the whole family.

Can play on TV Handheld games This game device can play when you are outside in the waiting room or boring bus trip or a long flying journey.As well,you can plug and play on your big TV screen with the included AV output cable when you are on a vacation at home.
Sensitive Buttons Super Outstanding Game Experience The console has super sensitive buttons for precision control all buttons can be configured.
Large capacity Longtime Playing The battery is rechargeable and in large capacity: 600mAh, Each full charging enable you play up to 5~6 hours.

Specification Tips of Handheld Game Console 1.Before connect to a TV, make sure that your TV and the unit are turned off. 2.Switch the channel on TV to the Audio/Video channel. 3.This game console does not have the function of saving the progress of the game. When you quit the game, all progress will be zero. 4. If you have any questions, please let us know as soon as possible and we will resolve them for you immediately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the $24
reviews.reviewText: I picked this up after dropping an earlier version of the same thing into some water, which killed it. The new one seems to have slightly better screen resolution and (yay) the addition of a headphone jack, which was sorely missing on older models. It seems well made (at least for the price point) and it works perfectly. Of the 168 games included on it, about 20 are actually playable/worth playing, but even if all you ever do on it is play Dr. Mario, Dig Dug or Donkey Kong, you'll absolutely get your money's worth out of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for car rides!
reviews.reviewText: We got these at Christmas for both of our kids, specifically for car rides and other places without internet or computer access. The games are great and the adults love them, too. It was a lot of fun watching the kids show all the older family and them playing back and forth. They charge well and the battery last a good while, but you'd have to charge them if traveling more than a couple hours. The only real downside is that progress isn't saved, so they start over every time the start the device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good with a Few Minor Annoyances
reviews.reviewText: Nostalgic value = ImmenseTime killer = AbsolutelyFun to play = Yes!Game options = 168It's really that simple from an enjoyment perspective. I really like this thing so far. My only beefs with it are as follows:1) High scores are not retained after shutting it off. Unless you plan on leaving it on perpetually, don't expect to see your high scores next time you pick it up.2) The buttons (particularly the A/B/X/Y ones) are smaller than I expected. That said, I'm a big dude with big hands, so I'm sure this is just a personal preference for them to be bigger. They'll be fine for most folks I'd imagine. The smaller buttons also didn't really make it difficult for me to play, but just a tiny bit less comfortable.3) No battery level indicator. There appears to be no way to tell if the battery is running out. That said, I've played it for around 5-6 hours so far without the battery running out, so I figure if you just plug it in when you aren't using it then you shouldn't have any problems.4) Lots of games to choose from, but they seem to be in a random order in the list. I would have expected them to be in the list alphabetically, but they aren't which can make it annoying to find a particular game.5) Screen is harder to see in high sunlight. This didn't really surprise me as it's a common issue with electronics, but I just thought I'd mention it.Overall, I'm happy with this game "console" for what it is, but the annoyances are causing me to give it 4 stars instead of a full 5.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Overall good value, ton of games, While checking the old games, I noticed the pad feels like it is lagging in terms of response you had to really push down the right, down, etc. However my kids love it for now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DON'T BUY! IT'S A RIP OFF!!
reviews.reviewText: The gaming console was supposed to be yellow. I got a black one with a huge scratch on the screen. Then, the hand held game didn't work unless it was plugged in and the cord had a short in it. My son still wanted to keep it because he thought he was doing so awesome at playing the games. That's when I actually took a look at the gaming console and I realized that my son wasn't actually playing the games! The games played on their own and my 5 yr old just thought he was playing! I was flabbergasted! I couldn't believe that we had been scammed! I immediately returned it after seeing that! So, don't waste your money. It's cheaply made, the battery life is terrible and you're not really playing the games...the games are playing themselves!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Nice quality. Battery life is decent. Kids love all the games.Gotta start them on the classics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect intro to gaming for little ones.
reviews.reviewText: My 5 year old told Santa that he wanted Mario for Christmas on his tv 😩 I was not ready to buy video games but I saw these and thought the price was perfect. I bought my 3 and 5 year old boys each one for Christmas. Huge hit! They have so much fun playing Mario and a lot of the other games like superman and excite bike. The batteries last forever I’ve only had to charge them once or twice since Christmas. We have not tried to hook it up to the TV yeah we do want to try that eventually. My 12-year-old girl thinks it’s fun to play too and so do my husband and I. great value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Down Button Already Broken
reviews.reviewText: We've only had this for a little over a month, and we don't even play it often, but the down button is already not working. It's super frustrating cause everything else has been fine. We especially like the headphone jack so my son can play it while we're at rehearsal and not disturb anyone.

The media could not be loaded. At first I was very excited, but as I started to play within 5 mins this unit - kept going back to its home screen if ever two buttons were pressed at same time. Very irritating and cannot play any game..

reviews.reviewTitle: Value for money (186 games) Great for pooping
reviews.reviewText: Its very cheaply made, the buttons seem to be on the same board as the others in the area of the case making it feel cheap and flimsy.There are sometimes visual artifacts on the screen but not that noticeable (just streaks etc)There are only 186 games on the ROM and not 400Perfect for a kid or if you just want to keep busy on the train or taking a poop
I only tried a couple of games. When playing Super Mario, my character only jumped half the height, making the game unplayable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handheld Games Console for Kids Classic Games 8 Bit

reviews.reviewText: good toy for the price, though I do wish it would remember language settings. i haven't tested to see if the games remember saved stuff or not.
